column2: WEST VIRGINIA DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column6: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column8: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column10: proceed with caution until you see a train.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column8: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 3. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.
column8: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.

column2: 4. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column8: minimum speed

column2: 5. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column6: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column8: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column10: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.

column2: 6. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 7. When driving on major highways you should:
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 8. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: No Turning

column2: 10. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: Police officer

column2: 11. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column8: Before the crosswalk.

column2: 12. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 13. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 14. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To halt the traffic flow.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 15. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 16. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column6: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: indicates that you should drive with caution.

column2: 17. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column8: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 18. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 19. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column8: yellow; black

column2: 20. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 21. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 22. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you cannot see without moving your head.
column6: you see in your rearview mirror.
column8: directly behind your vehicle.
column10: you see in your side mirror.

column2: 23. This sign is a:
column8: warning sign.

column2: 24. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column8: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column6: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: Traffic signal ahead
